On Thursday, September 11, 2014, I attempted to make a $400 payment to Wells Fargo using the Citibank Application on my iPad. When I processed the payment, a box popped up on the Citibank site that stated the request could not be processed and to attempt again later. The following day, using my laptop, I made the payment and everything was fine.I checked my account on September 13, 1014, this morning, and it registered TWO payments of $400 to Wells Fargo. I called customer service and attempted to cancel the second one, but was told that the system wouldn't allow it. The representative then recommended I contact Wells Fargo to try and handle the matter.Really? The error was Citibank's. If you examine my account history since I added Wells Fargo as a payee, I make $400 payments once per month. Never twice. The only reason I did two payments was YOUR site told me the initial payment was not able to be processed. And now that I made another payment, YOUR customer service is telling me there isn't anything Citibank can do?When I first got through to Customer Service, the representative gave me a canned speech about how she saw I've been a loyal customer of Citibank's for 23 years and how Citibank appreciates that. This is what a customer receives as a reward for being with Citibank for 23 years? It is Citibank that should be dealing with Wells Fargo, trying to fix this problem, not me. It's $400, money I need to pay other bills and now, due to Citibank's error, I have to stress and try and recover these funds?On Monday, I will go to my local Citibank in Ossining, N.Y. on Pleasantville Road and close out my accounts. Chase is right down the street, as is TD Bank. While I realize I don't have any vast sum of money in your bank, the truth is I HAVE been a customer for over twenty years and in no way, shape or form do I appreciate being treated this way. If the error was mine, then I would have no issue....but it ISN'T mine. I work at my job and I earned that $400 and you should be working at YOUR job to recover it, not me, as the mistake was YOURS.I have three young boys and will make sure they know the value of customer service and how, as a customer, they will have the right to expect a level of service from whichever companies they choose to do business with in life. I will make sure they know the level of service from Citibank is sorely lacking and that, as they grow older, they can do their banking elsewhere.Kevin Lynch
